page.title: 08WATER PROBLEMS..
page.content: Our D_Block can be divided into two parts,namely the slopes of Weddersbie Hill and the lower, flatter land at the foot of the slope (the present line of the A 91 road is more or less the dividing line).On the hill slopes, the farmers tend to plough along the contours,so the rain water run_off and soil erosion are reduced.Water diviners have been empolyed to help locate water on Rossie Farm, as during dry spells (eg.the summer of 1983) there is no water for irrigating the crops.Further east, however, at Caldwells and Meadowells, another natural feature can be found.Natural springs have been used since early times and water extracted by means of a few wells.A windpump, now disused, pumped up the water for people on the hillsides and on the valley floor.
